name: Jurys Inn Dublin Custom House

reviews.text: We stay in this hotel on a regular basis as it is convenient to the O2 theatre and the city centre. Family rooms are excellent as there is two double and one single bed in each room. The staff are very friendly and the food is good.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: Stayed 1 night and selected the hotel based on reviews on this site. The location was quiet and I was not disturbed by rowdy revellers and the hotel clean with pleasant staff. Breakfast was a 'full Irish' and included in the price. Would recommend and would stay again. (Only 10 minute walk along the Liffy to the felshpots of Dublin.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Good Price okay location

reviews.text: What a great hotel, stayed 5 nights then went on a tour for six days came back spent another two nights , very clean, comfortable and very helpfully friendly staff, great breakfast, and very nice food in the restaurant as well, would stay here again . Only ten minuets walk into the centre of town.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We had a great stay in the Jurys Hotel our rooms were clean and beds comfy. Breakfast was delicious and cost 10euro 50cent for a full breakfast. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location was central for shopping and bars being within 15 min walk. Would definitely return again.
reviews.title: weekend away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night at the Jury's Inn, excellent location, close to the main sections of Dublin. Very good room with ensuite, excellent service and very good Dinner and Breakfast. One again Haggis was on the Breakfast menue, not a fan, however you don't have to eat it. An enjoyable up market place to stay and highly recommended.
reviews.title: Another enjoyable Irish Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay at the Jury's Inn. Check in was efficient and rooms were clean and comfortable. The sites that we wanted to see were within easy walking distance as was Connolly train station (where we took day trips from). The staff went out of their way to accomodate us in a courteous manner.The staff were especially helpful during our one and only negative experience in Ireland.After the incident, we were directed to get help from the Garda. While the local Garda was unhelpful and rather rude, the hotel reception was very helpful and helped us fix our problem within 10 minutes!Thank you so much.I will most definitely stay at the Jury's Inn Custom house if/when I visit Dublin again.
reviews.title: R and R visit Dublin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just had a 4 night stay at Jurys Inn Custom House, 2nd time at this hotel looking forward to our next stay. rooms were beautiful, food was delicious, staff were very friendly and helpful, always good to have a nice friendly smile at reception every morning, just cant wait to return to Dublin, three cheers for the staff at Jurys Inn. Mairead and Pat Belfast.
reviews.title: July 2013, best hotel for your holiday breaks in Dublin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights and picked the hotel as it was close to rental car drop off.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: The hotel overlooks the river and is within walking distance of everything to see in Dublin.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.text: The O2 centre is just a short walk away whilst all of Dublin is just across the river Liffey.
reviews.title: Excellent service
Cheap and cheerful!
reviews.text: We were staying at this hotel for the Michael buble concert! It was a 15 minute walk to the O2! It was clean, cheap and cheerful! It also did a buffet after the concert which I thought was a good touch! Staff at reception was pleasant and helpful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel and well located in Dublin.10 minutes from O'Connell street. Rooms are spacious and tidy and its in modern decor. Close to the Famine Memorial and on the banks of the river. Rooms are quiet as well. Good nights sleep had.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Good location but not the one if you want luxury!
reviews.text: Jury's Inn is a pleasant enough hotel with good service from the front desk staff. Location is good being just a ten minute walk to the Temple Bar area and shopping districts....although if going out of a night in heels you'll need taxis on those cobbled streets!

Rooms overlooking the road are noisy in the summer as there is no air con so you have to have the window open so if going in the summer choose a room at the rear of the hotel. A good hotel as a base to explore but not the one if you're looking for a little luxury. Taxi from Temple Bar area costs about 8 euros.
reviews.title: Great location: rooms need updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is probably the best located hotel within the IFSC if you need to go into the heart of Dublin's entertainment & shopping district, The staff were very helpful througthout our visit but there is no pool, the breakfast was unusually poor for Ireland and the rooms and corridoors need updating. I travelled with 2 yound children: the river facing room was quiet but matress was so thin on the sofa bed even young chidren were uncomfortable. I would stay here if you have a busy schedule, get a good rate(don't add breakfast) but would consider elsewhere if you want comfort & more hotel facilites. .
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: Our group stayed one night in this hotel, and none of us encountered any problems. The stay was pleasant and all aspects of the service, staff, rooms were all in good condition, and clean. I found the staff very helpful and friendly, as I needed to ask for various things such as directions from them many times during the evening. The location is spot-on.
reviews.title: A good hotel at an excellent location in Dublin

reviews.text: This is a lovely clean modern well located hotel, stay ere a few times for different things, wasn't to keen on da food in the hotel restaurant but found a lovely restaurant just out the back of hotel so was happy them, rooms are average size for a hotel but comfortable the view of the river liffey from our room was lovely as well as well, staff were very friendly and helpful :) xx
reviews.title: Great Hotel :)

reviews.text: We stayed here for a weekend in July but it happened to be one of the hottest weekends of the year! We got to the hotel quite late on the Friday night to find the windows only opened about 2 inches because of bar's on them and the rooms didnt have any form of air conditioning! We melted! Other than that the hotel was perfect for our weekend. Bus routes run regularly (get the weekend pass for the Dublin bus co rather than the tourist one its cheaper and does the same routes without the commentary) or temple bar is about a 10 min taxi ride (€7ish). We also ordered pizza into 6he hotel on the first night and reception were very helpful in terms of directions to.cash machine's and the best pizza place!
reviews.title: Great location but not for hot weather!

reviews.text: The hotel fronts the river in the custom house area. Close to the old town and the restaurants in the Temple Bar area. Room and bathroom are adequate and clean, though no air-conditioning, it is cool especially at night even during the summer. The airport bus stops almost in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Value, Value, Value

reviews.text: We stayed here in August on a 3 day break with friends. We were able to check in early and the rooms were clean and comfortable overlooking the Liffey. Perfect location being just 10 mins from the hustle & bustle and therefore peaceful at night, but all the bars and attractions are a short walk, or tram ride away. Rooms very clean and a great nights sleep, perhaps noise would be an issue on hot nights as the windows need to be closed to avoid traffic noise but rooms at the rear would be quieter..but we all slept very well. Great breakfast and the bar/lounge is a nice place to relax in . Staff very friendly and helpful, we would definitely go again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, good value, great service, clean and comfortable

aka: Jurys Inn Custom House Hotel Dublin
